parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Attributes that the user wants to set in new app.

post.description:
Imports an app into the system.
This operation in autoreplace mode is supported only in EFE mode.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the target app.

parameters.name: spaceId
parameters.description: The space ID of the target app.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The import mode. In `new` mode (default), the source app will be imported as a new app with generated attributes.
In `autoreplace` mode, the attributes from the source app will be retained and imported with the app.
The app-id is extracted from the source app and used as the target app-id. If the app exists, it will be replaced.
Approved objects in the target app that are not available in the source app will be removed.
Non-approved objects in the target app will not be removed.

One of:
* NEW
* AUTOREPLACE

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The app ID of the target app when source is qvw file.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The file ID to be downloaded from TCS and used during import.

parameters.name: fallbackName
parameters.description: The name of the target app when source does not have a specified name, applicable if source is qvw file.

get.description: Gets the app privileges for the current user, such as create app and import app. Empty means that the current user has no app privileges.
Retrieves information for a specific app.

put.description: Updates the information for a specific app.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Attributes that user wants to set.

parameters.name: dstUpdate
parameters.description: Attributes that should be set in the copy.

get.description:
Retrieves the lineage for an app.
Returns a JSON-formatted array of strings describing the lineage of the app.

Retrieves the data model and reload statistics metadata of an app.
An empty metadata structure is returned if the metadata is not available in the app.

parameters.name: NoData
parameters.description: The flag indicating if only object contents should be exported.

get.description:
Gets media content from file.
Returns a stream of bytes containing the media file content on success, or error if file is not found.

put.description:
Stores the media content file.
Returns OK if the bytes containing the media file content were successfully stored, or error in case of failure, lack of permission or file already exists on the supplied path.

delete.description:
Deletes a media content file or complete directory.
Returns OK if the bytes containing the media file (or the complete content of a directory) were successfully deleted, or error in case of failure or lack of permission.

get.description:
Lists media content.
Returns a JSON formatted array of strings describing the available media content or error if the optional path supplied is not found.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to sub folder with static content relative to the root folder. Use empty path to access the root folder.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
Optional. List output can include files and folders in different ways:
* Not recursive, default if show option is not supplied or incorrectly specified, results in output with files and empty directories for the path specified only.
* Recursive(r), use ?show=r or ?show=recursive, results in a recursive output with files, all empty folders are excluded.
* All(a), use ?show=a or ?show=all, results in a recursive output with files and empty directories.

get.description:
Gets media content from file currently used as application thumbnail. Returns a stream of bytes containing the media file content on success, or error if file is not found.
The image selected as thumbnail is only updated when application is saved.

post.description: Publishes a specific app to a managed space.

put.description: Republishes a published app to a managed space.
Sets space on a specific app.

delete.description: Removes space from a specific app.

attributes.description: Attributes used when creating an application

spaceId.description: The space ID of the application

privileges.description:
Application privileges.
Hints to the client what actions the user is allowed to perform.
Could be any of:
* read
* create
* update
* delete
* reload
* import
* publish
* duplicate
* export
* exportdata
* change_owner
* change_space

create.description: Object create privileges. Hints to the client what type of objects the user is allowed to create.

NxAttributes.description: App attributes. This structure can also contain extra user-defined attributes.

lastReloadTime.description: Date and time of the last reload of the app.

createdDate.description: The date and time when the app was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date and time when the app was modified.

dynamicColor.description: The dynamic color of the app.

published.description: True if the app is published, false if not.

publishTime.description: The date and time when the app was published, empty if unpublished.

hasSectionAccess.description: If set to true, the app has section access configured,

encrypted.description: If set to true, the app is encrypted.

originAppId.description: The Origin App ID for published apps.

JsonObject.description: Contains dynamic JSON data specified by the client.

resource.description: Type of resources. For example, sheet, story, bookmark, etc.

canCreate.description: Is set to true if the user has privileges to create the resource.

attributes.description: Attribute used when updating the application

discriminator.description:
A string indicating the origin of the data:
* [filename]: the data comes from a local file.
* INLINE: the data is entered inline in the load script.
* RESIDENT: the data comes from a resident table. The table name is listed.
* AUTOGENERATE: the data is generated from the load script (no external table of data source).
* Provider: the data comes from a data connection. The connector source name is listed.
* [webfile]: the data comes from a web-based file.
* STORE: path to QVD or TXT file where data is stored.
* EXTENSION: the data comes from a Server Side Extension (SSE).

statement.description: The LOAD and SELECT script statements from the data load script.

reload_meta.description: Metadata for the last app reload.

static_byte_size.description: Static memory usage for the app.

has_section_access.description: If set to true, the app has section access configured,

cpu_time_spent_ms.description: Number of CPU milliseconds it took to reload the app.

hardware.description: Hardware available for the engine doing the reload.

peak_memory_bytes.description: Max number of bytes used during reload of the app.

is_system.description:
If set to true, the field is a system field.
The default value is false.

is_hidden.description:
If set to true, the field is hidden.
The default value is false.

is_semantic.description:
If set to true, the field is semantic.
The default value is false.

distinct_only.description:
If set to true, only distinct field values are shown.
The default value is false.

is_locked.description:
If set to true, the field is locked.
The default value is false.

always_one_selected.description:
If set to true, the field has one and only one selection (not 0 and not more than 1).
If this property is set to true, the field cannot be cleared anymore and no more selections can be performed in that field.
The default value is false.

is_numeric.description:
Is set to true if the value is a numeric.
The default value is false.

tags.description:
Gives information on a field. For example, it can return the type of the field.
Examples: key, text, ASCII.

byte_size.description: Static RAM memory used in bytes.

hash.description: Hash of the data in the field. If the data in a reload is the same, the hash will be consistent.

is_system.description:
If set to true, the table is a system table.
The default value is false.

is_semantic.description:
If set to true, the table is semantic.
The default value is false.

is_loose.description:
If set to true, the table is loose due to circular connection.
The default value is false.

byte_size.description: Static RAM memory used in bytes.

subpath.description: Content library relative listing path. Empty in case of root listed or representing actual subpath listed.

spaceId.description: The managed space ID where the app will be published.

data.description:
The published app will have data from source or target app.
The default is source

* source: Publish with source data
* target: Publish with target data

targetId.description: The target ID to be republished.

data.description:
The republished app will have data from source or target app.
The default is source

* source: Publish with source data
* target: Publish with target data
